identificationModule.briefTitle: Combination of the Immune Modulator Dimethyl Fumarate With Intraarterial Treatment in Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Combination of the Immune Modulator Dimethyl Fumarate With Intraarterial Treatment in Acute Ischemic Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The investigators conduct this study to investigate whether oral administration of Dimethyl Fumarate, a Food and Drug Administration-approved drug for multiple sclerosis, is safe and effective in combination with intraarterial treatment in patients with Acute Ischemic Stroke.

armGroups.label: Intraarterial Treatment plus Dimethyl Fumarate
armGroups.description: Dimethyl fumarate 240mg orally twice daily for 3 consecutive days

armGroups.label: Intraarterial Treatment plus placebo
armGroups.description: Placebo 240mg orally twice daily for 3 consecutive days

interventions.name: Dimethyl Fumarate
interventions.description: Dimethyl fumarate 240mg orally twice daily for 3 consecutive days

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Placebo 240mg orally twice daily for 3 consecutive days

primaryOutcomes.measure: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)
primaryOutcomes.description: The NIHSS score ranges from 0 to 42 points. The higher the score, the more severe the neurological impairment.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1.18-80 years old 2. NIHSS score\>6 3. For the first stroke, MRI showed anterior circulation infarction 4. Patients who meet the mechanical thrombectomy treatment by MRI assessment within 24 hours

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Patients receiving Alteplase thrombolysis
2. Other diseases of the central nervous system
3. There has been a neurological disability in the past (mRS score\>2)
4. Difficulty swallowing
5. Arrhythmia, atrioventricular block
6. Use of anti-tumor drugs, other immunosuppressive and immunomodulatory drugs
7. Macular edema
8. Magnetic resonance angiography shows vertebra-basilar artery obstruction
9. Hemorrhagic stroke
10. Patients who are known to have hypersensitivity to dimethyl fumarate or any excipients of this product
11. Pregnant and lactating women
